data.title: Robert Card: What you should know about the Maine shooting suspect
data.meta_description: The suspect is a military-trained firearms instructor who allegedly threatened Saco National Guard Base.
data.text:
Synopsis

The suspect is a military-trained firearms instructor who allegedly threatened Saco National Guard Base.

Robert Card, who is wanted by police in Maine following the deadliest mass shooting in the state's history, had vowed to carry out a firearms attack at a US Army base, authorities have said.

#Budget' 2024 with ET

Budget Highlights: Your 2-minute guide

FM 's plan for Viksit Bharat: A look at key numbers

What's in Sitharaman's Budget for you?

Details about the 40-year-old suspect at the center of a massive manhunt following shootings at a restaurant and bowling alley in Lewiston on Wednesday night have begun to surface. At this point, the exact number of victims is unknown, but officials say at least 22 people were killed and many more were injured after the gunman opened fire.

Card, who has been labeled as "armed and dangerous" by police, is a military-trained firearms instructor who has just received mental health therapy, according to a US intelligence document.

Following the shootings, a notification was distributed to law enforcement personnel on Wednesday, October 25. It indicated that Card had been admitted to a mental health facility for two weeks over the summer but provided no further information regarding his treatment or condition.

Card also claimed to have heard voices and threatened to shoot at the Saco National Guard Base, according to the affidavit. Hundreds of officers are currently searching the state for Card.

Authorities have provided no further information regarding Card. The University of Maine confirmed that he studied engineering at the University.

According to Maine court records, a man called Robert Card, who was born on the same day as the suspect, was cited with speeding in 2001 and 2002. There were no other criminal records found in the state's electronic court records system or any of the other public records databases.

Maine public safety officer Mike Sauschuck told reporters, "He is a person of interest, and that's what we'll label them as moving forward until that changes. If they notice him, they should not approach him or make any contact with him.”

"In order to look into this matter, the suspect Robert Card, who is, once more, a person of interest and simply a person of interest—we have hundreds of officers searching the state of Maine."

Card's white SUV was discovered abandoned at a boat launch on the Androscoggin River in Lisbon Falls.

"Please contact law enforcement if you are aware of his whereabouts," wrote the Lewiston Police Department on Facebook.

After the truck was discovered, an order was issued for residents and business owners to stay inside and off the streets of the 37,000-person city from Lewiston to Lisbon, approximately 8 miles (13 kilometers) away.

FAQs:

Q1:Who is suspected for Maine mass shooting?

Ans. According to authorities, the suspect named Robert Card is suspected for the Maine mass shooting.

Q2: When did the Maine mass shooting occur?

Ans. The massive mass shooting occurred on Wednesday evening in Lewiston.
